intro: Chirita xinningensis, commonly known as the Xinning chireta, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces bright orange or yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes collected for horticultural purposes.
